text:
Acute hypercalcemic crisis after an open heart operation.
 Acute hyperparathyroidism developed in a previously normocalcemic 64-year-old woman during the first week after a coronary operation.
 Prolonged QT interval in the electrocardiogram and hypercalcemia were documented on the fourth postoperative day.
 Neck exploration on the fifth postoperative day revealed a lower right parathyroid adenoma.
 Parathyroidectomy resulted in rapid and dramatic improvement of the clinical picture and normalization of laboratory values.
